items.title: Motion heard to add 15 plaintiffs in TSMC lawsuit
items.summary:
- A federal court in San Jose is considering a motion to add 15 Arizona-based plaintiffs in an employment discrimination lawsuit against TSMC.
- The lawsuit, filed in August 2024 and refiled as a class action in November, alleges favoritism towards East Asian workers and a hostile environment for non-East Asian employees.
- TSMC has invested $65 billion in Arizona and plans an additional $100 billion investment announced in March 2025, complicated by these allegations.

items.title: Google adds AI tools to boost Workspace productivity
Wise to Open New Hub in India, Hire Hundreds in Tech Roles
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Wise to open a new hub in Hyderabad, India, in the second half of 2025 as part of its expansion.
- Plans to hire hundreds in product, engineering, and operations roles led by Smrithi Ravi, APAC head of engineering.
- New feature launched for Indian businesses to receive international payments in 8 currencies at mid-market exchange rates.
- Wise aims to grow its services in India, which it has been operating since 2013, processing about 10% of all remittances to the country.

items.title: Trumpâ€™s tariffs: Amazon cancels China, Asia orders
items.summary:
- Amazon cancels orders for products from China and other Asian countries after new US tariffs on over 180 regions.
- Affected items include beach chairs, scooters, and air conditioners; vendors received little notice on cancellations.
- Cancellations shift tariff burden back to vendors and impact Amazonâ€™s direct import orders, where they would pay tariffs themselves.

items.title: Chinaâ€™s Noematrix raises pre-A++ round for embodied AI
items.author: Lu Cewu, Wang Shiquan
items.summary:
- Embodied AI startup Noematrix raised between $30 million and $70 million in its pre-A++ funding round.
- Investors included Shengyu Investment, Zero2IPO Capital, Vision Knight Capital, and existing investors Prosperity7 and Sequoia China.
- Funds are aimed at enhancing AI models, data acquisition systems, and expanding commercial trials in various sectors.
- Founded in late 2023, Noematrix has completed four funding rounds and has a flagship product called Noematrix Brain.
- The CoMiner data system launched six months ago has secured nearly 100 orders and aims to improve data collection for AI development.

items.title: Wanted: First movers for Southeast Asiaâ€™s agentic AI leap
items.explanation: Fire can easily burn through a pass; no entry without a little heat!

items.title: Indiaâ€™s funding round sizes over the past 5 years
Indian B2B unicorn OfBusiness cuts tech staff by 25%
items.summary:
- OfBusiness has reduced its tech workforce by 25% due to the adoption of Generative AI (GenAI).
- Co-founder Nitin Jain announced the cuts during Inc42â€™s GenAI Summit on April 9.
- The company claims that operational efficiency remains unaffected by the integration of AI technologies.

items.title: Alphabet to invest $75b in AI, data centers: CEO
items.author: Sundar Pichai
items.summary:
- Alphabet plans to invest $75 billion in 2025 to expand data center capacity.
- CEO Sundar Pichai made the announcement on April 9, 2025, during a Google cloud conference.
- Funding aims to support Alphabet's core services and AI initiatives like Gemini AI model.
- This investment is part of a broader industry-wide AI infrastructure spending surge expected to exceed $320 billion in 2025.
- The commitment reflects Alphabet's view of AI as a strategic priority despite market concerns over return on investment.

items.title: OpenAI files countersuit against Musk
items.summary:
- OpenAI has filed a countersuit against Elon Musk, alleging harassment.
- The countersuit seeks to hold Musk accountable for damages and prevent further interference.
- Filed in the US District Court for the Northern District of California on April 9, 2025, it claims Musk has engaged in unfair practices during ongoing litigation regarding OpenAI's for-profit transition.
- Musk co-founded OpenAI in 2015 but has criticized its shift to for-profit, having started his own AI firm, xAI, in 2023.
- OpenAI argues this transition is necessary to secure $40 billion in funding by year-end.
- The legal battle is part of broader challenges facing AI development, including copyright lawsuits from The New York Times and prominent authors against OpenAI.

items.title: Google launches Ironwood AI chip for cloud computing
items.summary:
- Google unveiled the Ironwood chip at the Cloud Next conference, its seventh-generation TPU AI accelerator.
- The chip is designed for running AI models and will be available to Google Cloud customers later this year.
- Ironwood features clusters of 256 and 9,216 chips, offering up to 4,614 TFLOPs with 192GB RAM and 7.4 Tbps bandwidth per chip.
- An upgraded SparseCore technology enhances performance, reducing latency and improving energy efficiency.
- The launch reflects a shift in focus from model training to large-scale deployment of AI applications.

items.title: Redditâ€™s conversational AI search tool uses Google Gemini
items.summary:
- Reddit integrated Google Gemini into its conversational AI search tool, Reddit Answers, announced on April 9.
- Reddit Answers has been in beta since December 2024 and allows users to ask questions for curated summaries of posts and comments.
- The Google Gemini integration aims to enhance search relevance and provide faster responses and is currently available in English on web and iOS in the US.

items.title: Apple supplier Luxshare explores production shift over US tariffs
items.summary:
- Luxshare is considering moving production outside China due to US tariffs, with potential investments in the US market.
- Chairwoman Wang Laichun stated that tariffs would have limited profit impact but could benefit localization for US customers.
- The company is evaluating further investment in Southeast Asia, though Vietnam and India are currently unlikely options.
- Setting up a new production line can take up to 18 months, and no specific customers, including Apple, were named during the analyst call.
- Luxshare's production shift is part of a broader industry trend of moving away from China, exacerbated by rising Chinese labor costs and the pandemic.
- New tariff structures create substantial cost differentials, with tariffs on electronics from China at approximately 54% versus 26% for India and 36% for Thailand.
- Challenges exist in relocating manufacturing, including unmatched efficiency in Chinaâ€™s supply chain and potential quality control issues in new locations.

items.title: How this fashion brand stepped up with TikTok Shop
items.author: Ayu Rizeki
items.summary:
- Adco Pakis Mas, the manufacturer of Aerostreet shoes, operates primarily through direct-to-consumer online sales since its founding in 2015.
- In late 2021, Aerostreet launched a storefront on TikTok Shop to reach a younger demographic, facing initial challenges in adapting to the platformâ€™s unique consumer behavior.
- By 2024, they implemented TikTok's ACE Indicator System, improving product assortment, content strategy, and customer empowerment.
- The company reported a 50% increase in daily sales after launching a TikTok Shop-exclusive collection and leveraging engaging content and creator partnerships.

items.title: Bose Corporation backs Indian wearables startup Noise with $20m
Taiwan minister defends TSMC over $1b fine report from US
items.summary:
- Taiwanâ€™s Economics Minister Kuo Jyh-huei defended TSMC after reports of a possible $1 billion fine from the US Department of Commerce for export control violations.
- Kuo stated that TSMC complies with all regulations and has not been informed of any fines.
- The investigation is linked to a TSMC chip found in Huaweiâ€™s AI processor, with TSMC ceasing supplies to Huawei in September 2020 and notifying the DOC in October 2023.
- The potential fine could be double the value of any violating transactions, but TSMC has not made a public comment on the issue.

items.title: Israel unveils deep tech incubators for energy, medtech
items.summary:
- The Israel Innovation Authority announced the creation of two new Deep Tech incubators: Square One Labs Build and Edge Medical Ventures.
- These incubators will support startups in energy, infrastructure, and medical technology sectors with over 40 million shekels (US$10.8 million) in government funding each over the next five years.
- Anticipated private investments to exceed 120 million shekels (US$32.4 million).
- This initiative is part of a new â€œVenture Creation & Building Studioâ€ model that merges public and private capital to accelerate early-stage innovation.
- The incubators aim to build on Israelâ€™s 33-year history of government-backed innovation, supporting over 600 startups.
- Research indicates successful incubators must provide both tangible and intangible support, which these new programs aim to deliver through corporate partnerships and specialized expertise.

items.title: US-China tariffs war deepens, Trump raises tariffs to 125%
items.summary:
[US-China trade tensions escalate as President Trump increases tariffs on Chinese goods to 125%]
[The decision impacts a wide range of products and industries]
[Concerns grow over potential retaliatory measures by China against US goods]

items.title: Google Cloud launches Agent2Agent for AI collaboration
items.summary:
- Google Cloud has released Agent2Agent (A2A), an open protocol for AI agents communication.
- Developed in collaboration with over 50 technology partners including Atlassian and PayPal.
- A2A allows secure information exchange and coordination among AI agents across platforms.
- Built on standards like HTTP and JSON-RPC, ensuring integration with existing IT systems.
- Supports long-running tasks with real-time updates and feature capabilities.
- Core features include task management, capability discovery, and collaboration via JSON-formatted Agent Cards.
- Emphasizes learning from previous standardization challenges in other industries like healthcare.

items.title: Google upgrades Vertex AI with new generative tools
items.summary:
- Google announces updates to its generative AI models on the Vertex AI cloud platform.
- Enhancements include text-to-music, video creation, voice cloning, and image generation tools.
- Lyria and Veo 2 now in preview for music creation and improved video editing features.
- Chirp 3 audio model supports voice cloning in 35 languages.
- Imagen 3 image generator improved for object removal and image repair, all media is watermarked with SynthID technology.
- Enterprise AI competition highlighted with Amazon Bedrock holding a larger market share.
- Legal issues regarding AI training on copyrighted works remain unresolved, prompting Google to provide indemnity policies.
- The industry's focus shifts towards essential AI safeguards amid regulatory scrutiny and public concern.

items.title: Tesla launches Saudi sales despite EV infrastructure hurdles
items.summary:
- Tesla officially began selling cars in Saudi Arabia on April 9, 2025.
- Sales launch occurs on a key 900-kilometer highway linking Riyadh and Mecca, which currently lacks EV charging stations.
- Saudi Arabia has only 101 EV charging stations as of 2024, significantly fewer than the UAE's 261 stations despite a larger population.
- The kingdom aims to increase charging stations to 5,000 by 2030 as part of its EV adoption target of 30% by the end of the decade.
- Tesla's entry coincides with improving diplomatic relations between the US and Saudi Arabia under the Trump administration.

items.title: Australian lender firm Bizcap launches in Singapore
items.summary:
- Bizcap, an Australian non-bank lender, has launched in Singapore, its fourth market after Australia, New Zealand, and the UK.
- The company has funded over SG$6 million (US$4.46 million) since its entry and partnered with over 100 local brokers.
- Loans range from SG$5,000 (US$3,720) to SG$500,000 (US$372,051) with assessments taking under four hours and plans for same-day funding.
- New products, including caveat-secured loans and a revolving line of credit, will be introduced within 6 to 12 months.
- Bizcap aims to expand into other Asian markets in the next three years while enhancing tools for brokers and growing its local team.
- The alternative lending market in Singapore is projected to grow from US$2.90 billion in 2023 to US$6.78 billion by 2028, driven by a financing gap for SMEs.
- Bizcap's use of automated bank statement aggregation and open banking for credit assessment reflects a shift in evaluating SME creditworthiness.
- Rapid assessment times and same-day funding are key competitive advantages for Bizcap in the crowded alternative lending market.

items.title: Indian snack brand Letâ€™s Try bags $2.5m pre-series A
Israeli cloud startup Wing closes due to business struggles
items.author: Elad Ben-Israel
items.summary:
- Wing, creator of the open-source programming language Winglang, is shutting down due to business difficulties.
- The startup struggled to convert developer interest into a viable business model.
- Winglang aimed to simplify cloud development but failed to establish its product as essential for businesses, leading to financial instability.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia launched Glasswall to assist founders in choosing the right venture capitalists (VCs).
- Founders can anonymously share reviews about VCs, addressing the common practice of discreet comments about investors.
- The initiative aims to provide candid feedback to VCs and empower entrepreneurs with information for better decision-making.

items.title: Trumpâ€™s tariffs: 90-day pause for most nations, excludes China
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 90-day pause on higher tariffs for most countries on Apr. 9, 2025.
- The pause does not include China, where tariffs on Chinese goods were raised to 125%.
- A 10% global tariff is in effect, with specific exemptions for Canada and Mexico under the USMCA.

items.title: US police drone startup Brinc Drones raises $75m
items.summary:
- Seattle-based drone startup Brinc Drones raised $75 million in a funding round led by Index Ventures.
- Total financing for the company now totals $157.2 million since its founding in 2017.
- Brinc develops drone systems specifically for public safety and police agencies.
- Plans to integrate drones with Motorola Solutions' 911 call center software for emergency response deployment.
- Motorola Solutions was a participant in the recent funding round.

items.title: US VC firm Insight managing director to quit for new venture
items.summary:
- Liad Agmon, managing director at Insight Partners, to resign in the second half of 2025.
- He will launch a new entrepreneurial venture while remaining a senior advisor.
- Agmon co-founded Dynamic Yield, acquired by McDonaldâ€™s in 2019.
- Dani Aronovitz will continue to lead Insightâ€™s Tel Aviv office as the firm reaffirms its commitment to the region.

items.title: Samsung denies halting chip partnerships in China
items.summary:
- Samsung Semiconductorâ€™s China unit denies claims of halting partnerships with Chinese clients.
- The company's foundry business is operating â€œas normal,â€ according to an Apr. 9 WeChat post.
- This clarification comes amidst concerns over US restrictions on chip technology exports to China and speculation following TSMC's service halts to some Chinese clients last year.
- Samsung did not disclose details about its clients or compliance with US requests.
- The company is one of the few global foundries producing advanced chips at 7-nanometer technology and beyond, competing with TSMC.
- Samsung maintains partnerships to navigate competitive dynamics and geopolitical pressures in the semiconductor industry.

items.title: Israel leads in imaging, surgical robots, diagnostics
GenAI adoption in HK finance to hit 90% in 5 years: report
Google unveils new Gemini AI model for real-time tasks
A list of grants and freebies for Singapore startups
China censors US tariff content on social media
Surviving the funding game: how timing can make or break your startup
JD.com launches retail platform Joybuy in London
items.summary:
- JD.com has launched its retail platform Joybuy in London as part of international expansion.
- The platform offers various products: daily essentials, beauty items, electronics, and home goods.
- Joybuy features promotions like discounts and same-day or next-day delivery options.
- This launch aligns with the UK e-commerce market's projected growth to $160 billion by 2024.
- JD.com has over 100 overseas warehouses, enhancing delivery speed and reliability for customers.
- Previous expansions include the Ochama brand in Europe and a 27,000-square-meter automated warehouse in Poland.
- The company's strategy emphasizes logistics before market entry, focusing on operational excellence.

items.title: SG game studio opens pre-registration for mobile 8-ball pool game
Trumpâ€™s tariffs: China to impose 84% duties on US imports
SEA, your future looks tariff-ic
Trumpâ€™s tariffs may hit Nintendo Switch 2 sales
items.explanation: While the monkey is armed, a sonic boom can outpace bullets and shatter the sound barrierâ€”talk about a loud exit!

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity firm Cato Networks to raise $300m funding
Tech giants rebound after volatility, Nvidia leads recovery
EU seeks startup feedback to ease burdens under AI laws
Accel India leads $6.7m funding in agritech firm AgroStar
Japanese space startup Sirius to buy US rocket engines
Alibaba ecommerce unit recruits AI talent for innovation drive
Disney expands ad tech in Europe
Indian EV maker Ather Energy plans to cut $50m IPO: sources
Meta rolls out teen safeguards for Instagram, Facebook, Messenger
items.summary:
- Meta introduces new safety measures for teenagers on Instagram, Facebook, and Messenger to enhance protection for users under 18.
- Updates include restrictions on Instagram's Live feature and new parental controls for accounts under 16, requiring parental permission.
- Rollout of Facebook and Messenger's teen accounts will start in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada as part of compliance with the UK's Online Safety Act.

items.title: Accel Partner and Sports Club Owner Launch $1 Billion VC Fund
items.author: Ryan Smith, Ryan Sweeney
items.summary:
- Ryan Smith and Ryan Sweeney launched Halo Experience (HX One), a $1 billion venture capital fund focused on sports tech and experiential sectors.
- The fund aims to capitalize on the rapid growth of the global sports technology market projected to reach $55 billion by 2030.
- Industry experts prioritize fan engagement technologies as key investment areas in sports, highlighting shifts in audience interaction and content consumption.
